result.execSummary:
The defendant Horace L Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Stalking [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care, cognitive intervention and domestic violence counseling. Not to associate with any member of any gang. No contact, directly or indirectly, with the victim. Deft is allowed to go to Family Court to facilitate visitation with children, but that visitation must not include any contact with the victim. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Just be compliant with any child support or paternity order. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless sample has been previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.   AMENDED 05-07-2018:  CFTS.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment up to which SSD will not be affected.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  No association with gang members.  Comply with child support obligations.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including cognitive intervention, domestic violence assessment and counseling, anger management program. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

Court Reporter Leslie Johnson. Defendant Horace L Willis in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Defendant Horace L Willis in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court has reviewed prior PSI and  recent revocation packet.
State indicates Chapter 950 compliance, no additions or corrections to revocation packet.
Defense indicates discrepancy with DOC sentencing recommendation.

State requests 18 months IC & 18 months ES.
Defense requests CFTS with probation on felonies, and concurrent jail time on misdemeanor counts, consecutive to felony counts.  

BTC:  on 15CF1410 count 1:  6 months RCJ
count 4:  3 years WPS (18 months IC and 18 months ES)
no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's and breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare, and any other counseling deemed appro by agent
no association with gang members
no contact with vicitim
cognative intervention, domestic violence assmt and counseling
employment up to which SSD will not be affected
comply with child support obligations
anger management program
CIP and SAT eligible
DNA sample unless one is already on file with DOC.

on 15CM2213:  6 months RCJ, concurrent to count 1 on 15CF1410 and consecutive to count 4.  

Firearms/voting warnings given.
Costs including DNA assmt.
CFTS against count 4 - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting.
jail time can be served in prison system.
Atty Ekes
atty Ekes
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 20, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Ct 1: 940.19(1)-Battery; Ct 4: 940.32(2)-Stalking.  Cts. 2, 3, and 5 were previously dismissed and read-in. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the victim, F.P (person, property, residence or family).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
